key_channel_insights.line_content: 96 % of Air China website fares are now missing on OTAs (+4 ppts MoM); pricing risk is low overall but clusters on long-haul and non-CN routes.
59 % of itineraries are absent on metasearch (+42 % MoM) and the share of MSE-cheaper fares has dropped from 42 % to 22 %, shrinking cost-savings exposure.
GDS misses 98 % of website fares; when listed, 1.7 % price 4 % higher, concentrating on long-haul and non-China origins.

conclusion.line_content: This report provides a high-level summary of the price discrepancies observed across different channels.  It is important to note that the data contains many nuances depending on various factors such as market conditions, booking windows, and the competitive landscape. Understanding these subtleties can be critical in optimizing pricing strategies and ensuring competitive positioning.

As part of our 'PriceEye' solution, we are developing an intuitive dashboard designed to help your airline's analysts drill down into this data. This tool will allow you to uncover and focus on critical actionable insights, enabling your team to make data-driven decisions with confidence.

We are here to support you in leveraging these insights to enhance your revenue management and distribution strategies. Please don't hesitate to connect with our team for more information about how PriceEye can assist you in achieving your business objectives.

ota_highlights.line_content: OTAs failed to list 96.3 % of web fares last week, up 2.2 ppts WoW and 4.3 ppts MoM.
Only 1.2 % of displayed itineraries were OTA-higher and 0.02 % OTA-lower; average gap ±0.1 %.
Long-haul (7.2 % OTA-higher) and non-China origins (22.2 % OTA-higher) generate nearly all above-site pricing.

ota_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: ‘N/A’ rate keeps rising, signalling a widening OTA blackout.
Exact-match fares fell 1.5 ppts WoW, reducing consistency even where content exists.
Premiums remain modest (0.04 %) but concentrated on strategic routes.

ota_summary_by_region.line_content: 97.3 % of short-haul fares are absent; pricing deviations are statistically insignificant.
82.8 % missing, but 7.2 % OTA-higher and 9.9 % at parity create focused parity risk.

ota_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: Web fares missing 97.4 %; virtually no price deltas, indicating low domestic threat.
Coverage improves to 75.9 % ‘N/A’; however, OTA-higher jumps to 22.2 %, up 12.7 ppts WoW.

ota_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: 97.6 % ‘N/A’; OTA-higher only 0.8 %, limiting near-term revenue impact.
‘N/A’ falls to 93.7 % but OTA-higher rises to 1.9 % with a 0.05 % premium.

mse_highlights.line_content: 59.5 % of itineraries missing on metasearch, up 25 % WoW.
MSE-cheaper itineraries fell from 42 % to 22 % MoM, cutting customer savings exposure.
75 % of searches within 14 days show no CA offer, limiting high-yield reach.

mse_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: Undercutting incidence down 20 % WoW; average discount ‑0.48 %.

mse_summary_by_region.line_content: 60 % missing; only 22 % cheaper, mirroring total trend.
56 % missing, but parity improves to 23 %; discounts drop to 20.5 %.

mse_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: 59 % not found; 22.5 % cheaper by ‑0.49 % where shown.
65 % not found; discount share only 12 %, weakest of all segments.

mse_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: Coverage improves (31 % missing); parity dominates at 50 %, discounts fall to 19 %.

gds_highlights.line_content: GDS availability slipped another 1.5 ppts WoW.
When present, 1.7 % of fares carry a 4 % markup; discounts virtually nil.
Long-haul 9.3 % and non-China origins 32.7 % GDS-higher despite recent easing.

gds_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: Distribution blackout continues to widen (+2.4 ppts MoM).
Parity remains negligible, no material trend.
Incidence down 1 ppt WoW but still at a 4 % premium.

gds_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: 64.4 % missing; 33 % of shown fares 4 % higher (-19 ppts WoW).

gds_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: 95.7 % missing; overpriced share grows to 2.7 % at same 4 % premium.
